mdRecord.dcterms:title: Agricultural and geological map of Tennessee: showing also topographical features, as well as railroads, county boundaries, county towns, &c / to accompany the reports of the Bureau of Agriculture, prepared by order of the Bureau by Jas. M. Safford
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Safford, James M. (James Merrill), 1822-1907 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Color-coded for geologic formations matched to lands, soils, crops, etc. [original]
Shows railroads, including incomplete and proposed lines. [original]

Cross sections: Section across the valley of East Tennessee from Cumberland tableland to Unaka -- A geological section from the Mississippi River through Dyer County, Nashville, Sparta, Kingston, Knoxville, Newport, Paint Rock to the Warm Springs in North Carolina. [original]
Inset: The Well's Creek Basin in Stewart County. [original]
Relief shown by hachures and spot heights. [original]
Appeared in: Introduction to the resources of Tennessee / by J.B. Killebrew, assisted by J.M. Safford ... Nashville, Tennessee Bureau of Agriculture, 1874. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Geology--Tennessee--Maps
